item.title: CS133-lecture-20210125
item.description: Abstraction # A generalization of something too complext to be dealt with in its entirety For humans not computers It is a techinque we use to compensate for the relatively puny capacity of our brains There aren’t enough neurons (or connections) in our brain to process the rich detail around us during a single moment in time Successful designers developer abstractions and hierarchies of abstractions for complex entities and move up and down this hierarchy with splendid ease.
